'Can't think straight' means your body is saying stop.
Unrealistic deadlines become emergencies when someone decides they should.
tips: Tonight: One boundary. Say no to one non-critical request, even if it's hard
Tomorrow: Block 15 minutes for just breathing, no calls
Document this pattern (dates, deadlines, being singled out) — for your records or HR if needed
good.closing_line: You're not failing. The system is designed to burn you out.

why_bad_is_bad: Normalizes burnout ('work stress is normal') — dismisses severity
Toxic positivity ('every challenge makes you stronger') ignores systemic abuse
'Remember why you chose this job' = gaslighting (implies user's fault for being upset)
False promise ('hard work will be recognized') — not guaranteed, feels patronizing
Prescriptive advice ('talk to your boss') ignores power dynamics, could be unsafe
Gratitude guilt ('practice gratitude for having a job') minimizes real harm
Cheerleader tone ('you're doing great!') contradicts user's 'can't think straight' reality
No concrete micro-actions — all generic platitudes
Doesn't mirror specifics (boss behavior, deadlines, being singled out)
